page.title: 03Milborne Port- a History
page.content: The village is a place of great antiquity and before the Norman Conqest it was a Royal Borough of considerable importance.The entry in the Domesday Book shows that it contained several outlying properties some nearly ten miles away.Six mills were mentioned,but not all were in th parish.It was the third town in Somerset.Reinbald,the first pluralist held several rich benefices two of which were in Somerset. The name of the place is derived from "mill"on the "borne"or brook,"Port" signifies a town. Until the Reform Act of 1832 Milborne Port returned two members of Parliament.Earlier it was the place for the manufacturing of sail-cloth. Leather-dressing and glove-making hav been the principal local industries since the early 1800's.
